alert.note: Alert for Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 1:57PM CDT until July 04 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN RHEA COUNTY... At 257 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in Spring City. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring City, Piney Falls State Park, Stinging Fork Falls State Park and Grandview. This includes the following streams and drainages... Piney Creek, Piney River, and Vans Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Even after heavy rain has ended, flooded roads can be a hazard. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
